name: Provisioning new DXi installations
title: Provisioning new DXi installations
body:
Overview

The Tivian Sales team used to order new installations through the following survey: https://ww2.efs-survey.com/uc/order_survey/. 

Once the survey is filled out by the Sales team, it generates a ZD ticket with the required information. The Trilogy Sales team, on the other hand, is (for now) using the Creating a Ticket for Customer Support Team Based on Sales Orders article to manually generate the required tickets. 

We are in the works for streamlining this with the Sales team (for example having customers directly fill out the order survey), however, the CS process should not change.

From a high-level perspective, the process to configure new/clone installations is:

  • Customer reaches to Sales with their request
  • Sales fills in the survey OR logs the new ticket as indicated above
  • CS logs a SaaS CR so the new instance is provisioned
  • CS continues with the rest of the tasks
  • In some instances, the PS team may come back to CS requesting additional actions be performed, for example:
    • Adding Cronjobs to DXI Instances

Difference between a blank and a mirror/clone

Technically, all of them are "new installations", it's only a matter of what data that contain when they are created:

  • Blank installations - standalone installs, not using a "source" installation
  • Clone installations - they are created using a "source" installation that will carry over some configuration into the destination clone
  • Mirror installations - they are also created using a "source" installation, however, they have the very specific purpose of allowing the customer to do recovery, based on a backup taken right before they noticed missing data or any other issues; the mirror installations are short-lived, considering their purpose (usually 14-days).
  • Penetration Test for Ipsos - Bofa: This has a special process, to Sync the production installation into the staging installation, instead of creating a brand new installation. Check this section for details

The current process covers all the possible scenarios that you may encounter for blank and clone installations, and since they are all technically new installs, they can follow the same "checklist".

Process

The provisioning of DXI instances, as you can see above, requires actions to be taken by separate teams. Given the plethora of features in DXI, the provisioning can seem quite overwhelming, as it would require you to access several areas of DXI/EFS and different platforms. A shortlist of actions to be taken once the SaaS CR gets completed:

  1. Log a SaaS CR in the JIRA DXI project (template for the CR can be found in the Steps to Follow)
  2. Access service gateway to check installation health and also check/disable SSO (for clone instances)
  3. Create new installation in Globis
  4. Adjust the EFS instance
    1. Staff Management
    2. Core EFS configuration (property changes, modules etc)
    3. Special requests (depending on the type of installation and request in the ticket)
    4. Kantar/Ipsos specific actions
    5. Okta configuration
  5. Checking instance health after carrying out all of the above

Steps to Follow

Attached to this article you will find the EFS_Installation_Checklist.txt file which was devised by the legacy Tivian team to encompass all possible scenarios encountered when provisioning new instances.

While it may seem daunting at first sight, a lot of those sections may be skipped when carrying out a provisioning, as the file was created to cover all potential scenarios. Work is underway to simplify the steps or come up with a smart form to streamline this.

In order to successfully carry out a provisioning:

  1. Download the .txt file
  2. Open it in a text editor that has replace text capabilities (Notepad ++, VS Code, Cursor etc.)
  3. Start by building the SaaS CR template, using the information that was received in the ticket:
    1. Cluster - provided by Sales/part of order survey
      • AWS-DE = Prod-DE-03
      • AWS-US = Prod-US-03
    2. Technical name - generated by PHP script - if it is not provided in the initial request, please generate a technical name using https://ww2.efs-survey.com/uc/tech_name_generator/?a= .
      1. Replace the {{TECHNICALNAME}} placeholder in the .txt
    3. Type - provided by Sales/part of order survey
    4. Cron jobs - If not mentioned and if not a clone of an productive installation, crons can be enabled right away
    5. Alias domain - provided by Sales/part of order survey; if not mentioned as part of the request, we default to no.
      1. Replace the {{ALIASDOMAIN}} placeholder in the .txt
    6. Domain values - CS needs to decide based on the domain in the ticket; nameservers for the alias domain can be used to determine who is the owner of the domain (NS values opst.de indicates that the domain is Tivian-owned)
    7. MySight/DataVoyager - if not mentioned as part of the request, we can assume they are not required (we default to no)
  4. Save the changes made to the txt file (and rename it to EFS_Installation_Checklist_ticketID.txt) save it to the ticket, then create the SaaS CR using the template that was generated.
    1. Don't forget to attach the txt file to the ticket, as it will be used by other colleagues moving forward.
  5. Once the SaaS CR gets resolved, you can retrieve the txt file and continue with the rest of the tasks detailed in the .txt file using the same logic:
    1. Make sure to update the root password to the default one.
      • Check the article Changing-the-Root-Password-in-DXI-Installations-in-Bulk , but instead of applying the password update to all installations, run it only to the current one, below are the details:
        • Simply copy the hashed password from our testing installation
        • Then load the DB for the new installation (i then efslogin)
        • then run the update statement: 
          UPDATE users SET u_passwd = <default password hashed> WHERE uid = 1 AND u_account = 'root';
    2. Replace all {{PLACEHOLDER}} entries with their relevant real counterparts, and this will result in having all the information outlined and just ready to copy/paste in the EFS/Okta configurations.
    3. You will have a few legacy fields to fill in, on the Globis side of things, namely Netsuite fields
      1. If the installation is a clone, just copy all the details from the source installation from Globis
    4. If you are dealing with IPSOS/Kantar clone installations, the checklist has special steps for them, that are to be followed; so just make sure to search in the checklist for Kantar or IPSOS keywords to find those special steps.
    5. Make use of DXI/EFS Support Agent Accounts - new instance import CSV template - Google Sheets in order to import all the support agent accounts into the instance (for blank installations)
  6. Of course, once everything is up and running, you will need to respond to the ticket and inform the requester of the following:
    1. The new instance URL
    2. The login credentials (only for blank installs, as cloned instances contain the same accounts from the source installation), while making sure that you follow the guide for Securely Sending Passwords or Tokens.

Please watch this short video tutorial to give you a feel of the whole process before diving into it head first.

NEW: the dxi_install_checklist.html file was created based on the above txt file in order to help you with this task; instead of manually replacing the placeholders, the HTML file will do that for you. So just download the HTML file and generate the templates for going through the provisioning tasks.

 

Special Cases:

Penetration Test for Ipsos - Bofa:

  • Ipsos will periodically request a penetration testing environment based on bofaadvisorypanel.ipsos-forum.com (on BofA-US-01)
  • This is usually prepared by performing a Sync from  bofaadvisorypanel.ipsos-forum.com (gb8879) to Staging (zn3837.customervoice360.com)
  • Create a Saas CR as per the standard clone process, but specify the target as the existing staging zn3837 and clarify this is for Penetration testing.
  • Once Saas closes the CR, elevate the ticket to PS and request from them to review the staging for synchronization of the "Projekte" folder, which includes any customizations, SSO configurations, or IP restriction settings that the customer may have implemented.
    This step is needed since SAAS are not performing a full clone, but a staging refresh, which might be missing recent customizations from PS, 
  • Once PS team is done, proceed with the standard checklist, which would most probably not require any further action.
